page.title: 17Places of interest
page.content: In the High Street can be seen the Guildhall with ancient doorway and some fine ironwork;also the old market and ware house with arches filled in, at one time used as a charity school and now known as The Town Hall.Another interesting feature is the Ball Court, just off the High Street.This was built by W.Medlycott in 1847 and "meant for the health and amusement of the town."The stone base of a 15th century village cross now stands on Sansomes Hill just off the main road. There are some spectacular views to be had of the block from the tops of East Hill and Poyntington Hill. On the outskirts of the village are the thatched hamlet of New Town and the mills of Milborne Wick.
